title: Financial factors as determinant in influencing corporate investment decision: empirical evidence from Indonesian manufacturing firms
abstract: Conducted research study aim in examine factors influencing corporate investment decision with the existence of agency problem with asymmetry of information and managerial discretion in global economic condition nowadays. Applying dynamic panel data model, Generalized Method Model (GMM), research obtain result of relationship between financial factors toward corporate investment decision in Indonesian public listed manufacturing firm industry with sample of 65 corporate firms with a 5year observation. Result findings shows that in highly competitive market, the dependency toward internal generated fund will be significant, however, firm through qualified management could further rely on other source of fund, external funding when they unable acquire the capital expenditure as part of their corporate investment decision as one of their strategic planning, with internal source of fund as they urged to remain competitive in preserve their position in the market industry. Keyword: Corporate Investment decision, capital expenditure, cash flow, operating cash flow, profitability, market competition.
contributors: Josua Tarigan (Advisor 1); Saarce Elsye Hatane (Examination Committee 1); FOEDIJIAWATI (Examination Committee 2)
